description: Apply exhaustive logic decomposition. Cover all validation paths, calculation branches, and edge cases explicitly. Use inheritance for variations, not enumeration. Example: Order -> Creates, Validates, Calculates total, Submits (complete flow); ShippingCalculator base, InternationalShippingCalculator : ShippingCalculator (inheritance for variations).

do.description: Cover all logic paths, use inheritance for variations. Example: Order -> Creates, Validates, Calculates, Submits (complete flow); ShippingCalculator base with InternationalShippingCalculator : ShippingCalculator subclass (inheritance)

guidance.description: Show complete flow including validation, calculation, and persistence steps
example: Creates from cart: Order, Cart, Customer
Validates before submission: Boolean, InventoryService, PaymentGateway
Calculates total: Money, LineItem, TaxRate, ShippingMethod
(Complete flow: create → validate → calculate → submit - no steps skipped)

guidance.description: Use inheritance to handle variations instead of enumerating each permutation
example: Calculates rate: Money, Weight, Distance, Country, CustomsFees
(Base handles domestic, subclass extends with Country and customs)

guidance.description: Cover edge cases and alternative paths explicitly

dont.description: Don't enumerate permutations or skip logic steps. Example: ShippingCalculator with Calculates standard/express/overnight domestic/international (wrong - enumerate) vs base + subclass (right)

guidance.description: Don't enumerate every permutation as separate methods - use inheritance
example: Calculates standard domestic rate: Money, Weight, Distance
Calculates express domestic rate: Money, Weight, Distance
Calculates overnight domestic rate: Money, Weight, Distance
Calculates standard international rate: Money, Weight, Distance, Country
Calculates express international rate: Money, Weight, Distance, Country

guidance.description: Don't skip validation or intermediate steps
Don't hide error handling and edge cases
